thread.title: Injured Gabriel Jesus looks very mobile as Man City star shows off dance moves at NBA game alongside Ilkay Gundogan
thread.title_full: Injured Gabriel Jesus looks very mobile as Man City star shows off dance moves at NBA game alongside Ilkay Gundogan

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Injured Gabriel Jesus looks very mobile as Man City star shows off dance moves at NBA game alongside Ilkay Gundogan
text:
Injured Gabriel Jesus looks very mobile as Man City star shows off dance moves at NBA game alongside Ilkay Gundogan The Man City star got off to a blinding start after joining the club in January Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Gabriel Jesus living it up watching the NBA in New York Share this video Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Injured Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus looked very mobile as he attended a Brooklyn Nets game on Tuesday night. 
The 19-year-old got his Premier League career off to a flying start earlier this year, scoring three in four appearances. 
But the Brazilian picked up a metatarsal injury against Bournemouth and has been absent since early February. 
He was seen getting himself around Manchester's Trafford Centre two weeks ago on a mobility scooter - but it appears Jesus's recovery has stepped up somewhat. Gabriel Jesus at the Nets game (Photo: Gabriel Jesus / Instagram) 
The former Palmeiras starlet posted the above video to his Instagram last night - and it shows him standing up and dancing in the crowd. 
Jesus attended the game with teammate Ilkay Gundogan, who looked less than impressed with the Brazilian's efforts. Gabriel Jesus got off to a blinder (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
The German is also on the sidelines after picking up a knee injury against Watford in December. The 26-year-old underwent surgery and will miss the rest of the season. 
He did however post on Instagram to say he's still working on his fitness. 
Brooklyn Nets provided the striker with a personalised jersey for the game against the Detroit Pistons. 
The Nets ran out 98-96 winners with Gabriel in New York to continue his recovery from a metatarsal injury. poll loading Will Gabriel Jesus one day win the Ballon d'Or? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
